inputs.note:
Patient: Maria Santos
DOB: 03/15/1981 | MRN: MRN-1001

Subjective: 45F presents with high fever (38.5°C) and severe sore throat x3 days. Difficulty swallowing. No cough or rhinorrhea.

PMH: Hypertension (well-controlled on Lisinopril)
Allergies: PENICILLIN (anaphylaxis), Peanuts

Objective:
  Vitals: BP 140/90, HR 88, Temp 38.5°C, SpO2 98%
  HEENT: Oropharynx erythematous, tonsillar exudates bilateral
  Neck: Tender anterior cervical lymphadenopathy

Assessment: Strep Pharyngitis (rapid strep positive)

Plan: Start Amoxicillin 500mg TID x 10 days. Follow up in 3 days if no improvement.
inputs.meds:
Lisinopril 10mg PO Daily
Amoxicillin 500mg PO TID (NEW)
inputs.labs:
Rapid Strep Test: POSITIVE
WBC: 14.2 K/uL (H)
CRP: 45 mg/L (H)

flags.explanation: Patient is prescribed Amoxicillin, which is a penicillin-derived antibiotic. The patient has a documented Penicillin allergy (anaphylaxis) in their chart. This presents a potential medication-allergy conflict that warrants clinical review.
